title: CS, UBS take bids for MPC Kinetic and keep IPO hopes alive
text:
Queensland coal seam gas services business MPC Kinetic will have the hopes of a half a dozen initial public offering candidates on its shoulders on Thursday.

While MPC Kinetic is hardly a household name or – at $228.5 million – the biggest IPO contender this year, but its bookbuild will serve as an important litmus test for the float market at a time when there are plenty of others ready to follow in its wake and particularly from private equity backers.

Bookrunners Credit Suisse and UBS are expected to launch the IPO as advertised on Thursday morning.

Sources said there would be no change to the deal's $2.50 a share fixed price or structure, and it would launch with cornerstone investors already accounting for about one-third of the book.

MPC Kinetic has long-term contracts with coal seam gas producers in Queensland including QGC, Santos and Origin Energy. Peter Eve

MPC Kinetic management spent Wednesday at the annual Morgans investor conference to shore up investor support.
description: Coal seam gas services business MPC Kinetic will have the hopes of IPO candidates on its shoulders on Thursday.
